TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProgressBarStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the style that a uses to indicate the progress of an operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use the marquee style when you need to indicate progress is being made, but you cannot indicate the quantity of progress. The Marquee style is valid only when visual styles are enabled. The Continuous style is valid only when visual styles are not enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBarStyle Blocks = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates progress by increasing the number of segmented blocks in a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBarStyle Continuous = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates progress by increasing the size of a smooth, continuous bar in a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBarStyle Marquee = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates progress by continuously scrolling a block across a in a marquee fashion.
